comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Slightly bleached out copy lacking in depth of tone. This unfortunate as the large serial numbers on lower tails may not be easily discerned. Three A3D-2 Skywarrior of VAH-6 ‘Fleurs’, code ZC on tails. Lined up on port side of a Forrestal class carrier possibly beside Elevator Four. Nearest with very large Modex side number 12. Dart like emblem on side with single ‘Fleur de lis’ within. Last two or three digits of six figure serial number on lower tail. ….20. Black nosecone, early thin cockpit framing, periscope fairing beneath forward fuselage and rear gun turret. Wing with leading edge slats only on outer wing. It’s recorded in the two links below that VAH-6 equipped with A3D-2 Skywarrior was embarked on CVA-61 USS RANGER before or between Jan.3 & July 27, 1959 for a West Pacific cruise. During that period the squadron wore its tail code ZC. Later records indicate it wore the code of the air group to which it was attached: www.gonavy.jp/CV-CV61f.html www.gonavy.jp/navy/sqn/VAH06.html (credit and thanks to Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan and naval aviation historian) By searching this dedicated webpage to Skywarrior production (courtesy of'A-3 Skywarrior Association') : www.a3skywarrior.com/html_files/a-3production.html The nearest matches to the A3D-2 with serials ending with a 2 (or possibly 4) and 0 on the end are; A3D-2 138920 A3D-2 138940 A3D-2 142240 A3D-2 142640 So the aircraft nearest may be one of those. It would be great to know which one so its story may be researched and told. And the one behind. Nicely detailed and toned picture of a 1958 A3D-2 from VAH-6 on USS Ranger: a3skywarrior.com/index.php?nid=101759&s=gl&media_...

comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Color version of same picture with all details captured: www.vaq34.com/a3list/142640.jpg www.vaq34.com/a3list/142236-142673.htm www.vaq34.com/a3list/index.htm Thank you to this website above! A3D-2 142640 Crashed near Napa, California, on Sept. 18, 1959 while operated from NAS Whidbey Island by VAH-2. The aircraft behind is A3D-2 142240

comment.author: 45586426@N06
